title: R. Nicholas Burns - Wikipedia
snippet: Robert Nicholas Burns (born January 28, 1956) is an American diplomat and international relations scholar. He served as the United States ambassador to China from 2022 to 2025. He is now Roy and Barbara Goodman Family Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Relations at Harvard ...

title: R. Nicholas Burns - Former Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs
snippet: Ambassador R. Nicholas Burns was the Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs, the Department of Stateâ€™s third ranking official. Appointed by President Bush, he was confirmed by the U.S. Senate on March 17, 2005 and was sworn into office by Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice.
